text: Hi,  I am a dot net developer, recently I was given a project which required PII removal from free text. Very soon I realised that it‚Äôs not possible using c#. I  tried using Stanford.NER but it‚Äôs not effective unless u train the model as per your requirements. It‚Äôs then I started reading about NLP,  NER. Learned little bit python to implement SpaCy. But everything seems to stop at a point where I need to train the model so that it can give accurate result. I read blogs from Medium.com. Tried reading about ELMo but those models r too complicated for me to train. Specially as I totally a c# developer and scripts in Python and its environment are so new to me. Please help how to proceed with my entity extraction project.

author: @ajaxsa4125
text: Hi krish, nice content. A few junior devs also spoke to me about this. Your video was widely shared amongst the team. But I see a problem. It seems like you are in a way saying data scientist path is future through triangle analogy. My guys have spent 5 years already in .net. They are working on .net core /microservices. Am also training them for cloud and devops. Now a few are being obtuse and focusing on coursera courses on ml. It's great. But I feel they should focus on areas they already are good at. Your talk and video is negatively pushing them into a field where they will have to start from scratch. Please dont get me wrong. Your video is good and motivating but in the space they already are the can grow and have fine careers with .net/cloud. I feel they are more confused now. What do you feel? Ds/ML have a bright future but so does apis/devops/cloud.
